alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 6:26PM MST until July 05 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 625 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Lees Ferry to Waterholes Canyon. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lees Ferry, Marble Canyon, Waterholes Canyon. This includes the following slot canyons... Waterholes Canyon near Page, and other surrounding drainages. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 535 and 544. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 534 and 538. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jackass Creek, Paria River, Colorado River and Fall Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
